title: Capacitors - 3 capacitors with slab removed from Z

content.description: Three capacitors are connected in series, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"> <mn>1</mn> </math>. The capacitors are identical except that capacitor <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math> has air between its plates, whereas capacitors <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math> and <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Z</mtext></math> each have a dielectric slab of dielectric constant <math alttext="kappa greater than 1" overflow="scroll"><mi>κ</mi><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn></math> between their plates.
content.question:
If the dielectric slab is removed from capacitor <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Z</mtext></math>, as shown in Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"> <mn>2</mn> </math>, which of the following describes what will happen to <math alttext="delta V sub X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math>, <math alttext="delta V sub Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></math>, and <math alttext="delta V sub Z" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></math>, the potential difference across capacitors <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math>, <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Z</mtext></math>, respectively?

Potential difference across <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math>
 Potential difference across <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math>
 Potential difference across <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Z</mtext></math>

A
 Increases
 Increases
 Decreases

B
 Increases
 Decreases
 Increases

C
 Decreases
 Increases
 Decreases

D
 Decreases
 Decreases
 Increases

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
